Name: Cal Poly Classical Literature Club
Description: The Cal Poly Classical Literature Club is a discussion-based club aiming to help members reach a better understanding of modern art, language, and media through reading classics. It is easier to understand many references that appear in pop culture by reading the literature they originated from. Not only that, but reading classical literature gives us better insight into human history and reveals universal aspects of the human experience.
Summary: The Cal Poly Classical Literature Club is a discussion-based club aiming to help members reach a better understanding of modern art, language, and media through reading classics.

Name: Cal Poly Climbing Club
Description: Cal Poly Climbing Club offers a variety of social activities centered around climbing and the outdoors to help foster the climbing community. Activities and major events include organized indoor climbing meetups, crag cleanups, movie nights, and so much more. Additionally, our competition team attends USA Climbing competitions from the local to the national level each year.
Summary: The Cal Poly Climbing Club functions as an organization that supports social events that allow fellow climbers to meet one another and climb together. We also support a competition team that competes through USA Climbing as a recognized collegiate team.

Name: Cal Poly Club Baseball
Description: https://youtu.be/Gdjth5bbPj0
Summary: Club baseball team that is a member of the National Club Baseball Association (NCBA) and competes in the Sothern Pacific - West Conference. The club typically consists of a 26-32 player roster.

Name: Cal Poly Club Field Hockey
Description:
We are Cal Poly's official Club Field Hockey team! We travel to places like UC Davis, Santa Clara University, UC Berkeley, and UCSD to play games and have fun. The team is co-ed, and we welcome all levels of play. 

Our seasons are in the Fall [practices, League games] and the Spring [practices, to play in tournament(s) in May]. Please contact calpolyfieldhockey@gmail.com if you have any questions!
Summary: In the fall, we play other college field hockey club teams and, compete in tournaments such as Cal Cup in the spring. We consist of around 35 members who loving playing field hockey and being in a team environment.

Name: Cal Poly Cognitive Neuroscience Club
Description: The Cal Poly Cognitive Neuroscience Club is an interdisciplinary club, aimed at connecting students from all different majors to promote dynamic conversations within the field. The club will focus on creating valuable opportunities for members to grow as students and professionals by equipping them with the necessary skills for their future endeavors. The Cal Poly Cognitive Neuroscience club will strengthen connections to on-campus faculty research projects and off-campus opportunities.
Summary: A club dedicated to providing students with opportunities to learn about cognitive neuroscience and expand their social and professional networks in the field.

Name: Cal Poly College Republican Club
Description: We are Cal Poly's only openly Conservative club. We work to give Conservative and other right-of-center students a community to discuss current events, develop ideas, and engage in activism. Visit our Instagram page @calpolyrepublicans and fill out our Get Involved link in the bio.
Summary: The heart of conservative life on campus. CPCR is dedicated to the traditional values, constitutional rights, and the ideals of liberty that animate the American nation.

Name: Cal Poly Computer Engineering Society
Description: We are a social and educational community for the Computer Engineering (as well as all computing) majors of Cal Poly! We are a student-run society whose primary goal is to help students succeed in their major and get a jump-start into the workforce, as well as helping to bridge the gap between students and the department. Through networking events, academic projects and social events, we create a community of successful and hard-working students.
Summary: We are a social and educational community for the Computer Engineering (as well as all computing) majors of Cal Poly! We are a student-run society whose primary goal is to help students succeed in their major and get a jump-start into the workforce.

Name: Cal Poly Consulting Club
Description: Through mentorship, case workshops, internship preparation, and networking with seasoned professionals in the industry, CPC serves students both personally and professionally. Consulting demands diverse skillsets, so regardless of your major and experience level, there's a space for you at CPC! We invite everyone to join our meetings and feel free to reach out for any questions at calpoly.consulting@gmail.com or @calpolyconsulting on Instagram.
Summary: Cal Poly Consulting Club (CPC) serves as a campus resource to educate students on the consulting industry, bridging connections between students and firms. We aim to provide tools for students to learn, connect, and grow.

Name: Cal Poly Counter-Strike Club
Description: CPCS is Cal Poly's hub for all things Counter-Strike. We provide a community for all players, both casual and competitive! Join our discord for more info! https://discord.gg/XWqdPjg6VW
Summary: CPCS is Cal Poly's hub for all things Counter-Strike. We provide a community for all players, both casual and competitive! Join our discord for more info! https://discord.gg/PkPnZWmWAA

Name: Cal Poly Cricket Club
Description:
At the Cal Poly Cricket Club, we are dedicated to promoting and fostering the sport of cricket within our university community. We aim to create a vibrant hub for cricket enthusiasts and newcomers alike, offering a unique sporting experience on campus. Our club provides a comprehensive platform for students to learn, play, and appreciate cricket, overcoming the typical barriers to entry associated with this equipment-intensive sport.

We organize regular practice sessions, matches, and social gatherings centered around cricket. Our activities range from hands-on playing experiences to watching and analyzing professional matches, allowing members to engage with the sport at various levels. We're committed to skill development, offering coaching and training for players of all levels, from complete beginners to experienced cricketers.

A key feature of our club is the provision of all necessary equipment - including bats, balls, protective gear, and access to suitable playing areas. This ensures that anyone interested can try cricket without the need for personal investment in specialized gear. Through our inclusive approach, we aim to introduce the rich tradition and excitement of cricket to a broader audience at Cal Poly, fostering a diverse and enthusiastic cricket community on campus.
Summary: Mustang Cricket is a student organization dedicated to promoting cricket on campus. We provide equipment, facilities, and instruction to make cricket accessible to all students, regardless of prior experience.

Name: Cal Poly Crops Club
Description: The Cal Poly Crops Club is a student-led organization dedicated to connecting students with the agricultural industry through hands-on learning, professional development, and networking opportunities. We host biweekly meetings featuring guest speakers from across the industry, attend conferences and field days, and organize social events to build community among students passionate about crop production, agronomy, and sustainable agriculture. Anyone is welcome—come grow with us!
Summary: We are a social club in the CAFES department involved in connecting our students to industry professionals within the agriculture sector.
CategoryNames: College of Agriculture, Food & Environmental Science

Name: Cal Poly Cycling Team
Description:
Winner of the 2023 Team of the Year, Club Sports Awards

The Cal Poly Cycling Team is more than just a bike team, we're a community of like-minded individuals who embrace the love of two-wheeled adventures. Inclusivity is at the heart of our club, so whether you're aiming for podium finishes or simply seeking the joy of camaraderie, the Cal Poly Cycling Team is here to pedal alongside you and create memories that will last a lifetime. Not to mention, there’s no better place to make these memories than beautiful San Luis Obispo. With its picturesque rolling hills, sun-kissed coastline just a few miles away, and incredible mountain biking trails right in Cal Poly's backyard, we've got the ultimate playground for pedal-powered adventures. Whether you ride gravel, road, mountain, or anything in between, we've got a place for you. Come ride with us!

 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jwrz6pL-zZ4

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZKT5_QDIno0
Summary: The Cal Poly Cycling Team is a community of like-minded individuals who embrace the love of two-wheeled adventures.

Name: Cal Poly Democrats Club
Description: Our mission is to promote discourse, inclusivity, and engagement within the political process. Our club meetings are an educational space for students to learn more about politics at a local and national level.
Summary: Our mission is promote discourse, inclusivity, and engagement with the political process. Our club meetings are an educational space for students to learn more about politics at a local and national level.

Name: Cal Poly Distance Club
Description:
Winner of the 2022 Team of the Year, Club Sports Awards

Welcome to Cal Poly Distance Club! CPDC was founded to provide runners with an opportunity to compete outside of the NCAA. Now, almost a decade later, it has become one of the top running clubs in the country. Although we strive for excellence in competition, maintaining a friendly and inclusive community is just as important to us. CPDC is here to support anyone who wants to run. Whether you're aiming to win nationals, or more interested in going on an easy run, CPDC is the place for you. Be sure to check out our website https://calpolydistance.club/, and our WOW showcase video below for a snapshot of what we're all about at CPDC!

 

https://youtu.be/T6lZeIib3Qc
Summary: CPDC welcomes all competitive and recreational runners. We strive to provide an opportunity for runners to compete in college outside of the NCAA and a friendly environment for those looking to make friends and run.

Name: Cal Poly Ducks Unlimited Club
Description: This club will supply a gateway for students to become involved with wetland management and waterfowl conservation. The club will also volunteer for Ducks Unlimited to help put on dinners and raffles to support wetland conservation nationwide. The goal of this club is to allow students to come together and become social through their connection of enjoying the outdoors and supporting wetland and waterfowl conservation.
Summary: This club will supply a gateway for students to become involved with wetland management and waterfowl conservation. The club will also volunteer for Ducks Unlimited to help put on dinners and raffles to support wetland conservation nationwide
CategoryNames: College of Agriculture, Food & Environmental Science

Name: Cal Poly Economics Society
Description: Cal Poly Economics Society was created to provide a forum for intellectually curious students to discuss economics topics and current events. Additionally, Econ Society serves as a place where economics majors can seek registration guidance, gain clarity on difficult concepts, and foster connections with professors and industry professionals.
Summary: Cal Poly Economics Society was created to provide a forum for intellectually curious students to discuss  and learn about economics topics and current events.

Name: Cal Poly Entrepreneurs
Description:
Cal Poly Entrepreneurs is an interdisciplinary student launch-pad that is dedicated to the growth and development of entrepreneurship at Cal Poly. Our organization brings in experienced entrepreneurs as guest speakers, provides access to a large network of mentors and resources, and creates a powerful environment for student networking.
 
There is an incredible pool of diverse talent at Cal Poly, and our goal is to unite students from different majors, and provide them with support they pursue their ventures and passions.
 
https://youtu.be/Lie39TI_Sao
Summary: CPE is a thriving student entrepreneurial community on campus that brings together creative thinkers and doers to build world-changing ideas. Join us Tuesdays 6-7 pm in the Nash Innovation Lab.

Name: Cal Poly Fencing Club
Description:
https://youtu.be/P5yLOPso3vM

 

Practice Times:

Tuesdays 7-10PM, Thursdays 7-10PM

Club Details:

  • We meet twice per week on Tuesdays and Thursdays in the Rec to fence.
  • Club dues are $40 per quarter.
  • The club supplies all necessary rental gear for members.
  • New fencers receive lessons from our coaches in Fencing Basics, and the three fencing weapons, Foil, Saber, and Epee.
  • Fencers with prior experience can get more advanced, weapon-specific coaching and free-fence.
  • We compete in 1-2 tournaments per quarter against the UCs in our league. There are also opportunities to fence in USFA competitive tournaments for ranking.

Prior fencing experience is welcome, but not required. Our coaches will teach you everything you need to know. New fencers get a period to try out the sport before paying dues.

 

Have Questions?

Email us at Calpolyfencing@gmail.com! We're happy to answer questions about the club.
Summary: Sport fencing club for all Cal Poly students. We hold practices twice a week and attend at least one tournament a quarter. No experience or personal gear necessary to join.

Name: Cal Poly Fiber Arts Club
Description: We are a club for students interested in Fiber Arts including sewing, crocheting, knitting, embroidery, macramé, and many others. All skill levels are welcome!
Summary: Do you like to crochet, knit, sew, or embroider? Or are you interested in learning how? Come join the Cal Poly Fiber Arts Club where any skill level is welcome!

Name: Cal Poly Field Studies Club
Description: Field Studies Clubs creates an inclusive outdoor community for students of all experience levels, breaking down barriers to nature through accessible opportunities for connection, growth, education, and skill-building. We organize camping, backpacking, skiing, snowboarding, snowshoeing, bouldering, climbing, and hiking trips all year long for students of all levels. We provide gear, and rides, as well as many social events throughout the quarter for students to meet others with similar outdoor interests.
Summary: Cal Poly Field Studies organizes and plans camping trips filled with an adventure across the west coast to build a community, foster friendships, and learn about the surrounding areas.

Name: Cal Poly Fighting Game Club
Description: A general gaming club encompassing fighting games, platform fighters, etc. Our general meetings include tournaments, friendlies, and learning events. We hope to gather and improve the already growing fighting game community at Cal Poly.
Summary: A general fighting game community encompassing traditional fighters, platform fighters, etc.

Name: Cal Poly Film Club
Description: Cal Poly Cinema Club is a place for students who are enthusiastic about the world of film to find a network of peers with similar interests. This Club is a great place for cinephiles and casual film fans to meet up and discuss new releases or their longtime favorite films. Follow our Instagram: @calpolycinema and join the GroupMe through the link in our bio.
Summary: Cal Poly Cinema Club offers a great opportunity to meet and connect with fellow students who share an interest in films & filmmaking. We hold weekly film screenings on campus and the club is open to all interest levels.

Name: Cal Poly Fishing Club
Description: An organization that facilitates a network of students that enjoy fishing. The club is a great way to meet new people who share a similar interest and go on fun trips. This allows for unique social experiences, where newer fishermen can learn from more experienced peers for effective etiquette and risk prevention. In true Cal Poly spirit, this club aims to have students learn by doing after being taught basic safety, supported by club officers and members.
Summary: Fishing Club aims to provide a safe, social, and educational outlet for fishing in SLO. Rods, rigs, rides, and bait provided as supplies last. An informational session is required for safety purposes, afterwards expect free pier fishing with peers.

Name: Cal Poly Food Recovery Network Club
Description: The Food Recovery Network volunteers with local organizations to reduce food waste within the local community and donate it to those in need in order to fight the unequal dispersal of food and help reduce food insecurity of individuals and families in the San Luis Obispo community.
Summary: Cal Poly's chapter of the Food Recovery Network aims to give back to the community by combating food insecurity that exists within San Luis Obispo by reducing food waste that harms our environment and further contributes to climate change.

Name: Cal Poly Food Science Club
Description: The food science club offers students the opportunity to connect with other students interested in food as well as professionals within the food industry. In addition to our meetings, the club participates in Food Industry Expo's, Brewery Tours, Volunteering Opportunities, and much more!
Summary: Food Science Club provides opportunities for food science students to learn about possible opportunities and achievements in the food industry.
CategoryNames: College of Agriculture, Food & Environmental Science

Name: Cal Poly Game Development Club
Description:
Feast your eyes upon the one, the only, Cal Poly Game Development Club! CPGD is a club for people of all majors and skill levels who want to learn more about game development. We host weekly informational meetings where club officers give presentations on topics in game development and host engaging activities. Every two weeks, we also open the room for Saturday workdays as an opportunity for members work with each other on quarter-long projects, personal projects, or Cal Poly coursework. Finally, every quarter we run a 48-hour game jam, whether just at Cal Poly or as part of a larger collection. Here's a showcase of games we made 3 years back:

https://youtu.be/w-e4PeqpAV8
Summary: We are a club for anyone interested in game development to share ideas, collaborate on projects, and participate in events! All levels of experience are welcome and there will be plenty of opportunities to learn new topics (programming, art, music, etc).

Name: Cal Poly Geography Club
Summary: Cal Poly Geography Club is a club open to everyone with interests in our world, the environment, geopolitics, GIS, map-making, and anything related to geography!

Name: Cal Poly German Club
Description: The mission of the German Club is to bring together students of different levels of German language proficiency through their common interest in the German language and culture. By promoting an appreciation for German film, literature, art, music, history, and politics the German Club will strengthen an appreciation for international discovery and international awareness at Cal Poly.
Summary: Cal Poly German Club is the hub for all things German at Cal Poly. We help our members improve their skills in German language while also encouraging the exploration of German culture, which includes German cinema, German cuisine, and German history.

Name: Cal Poly Golf Club
Description: The Cal Poly Golf Club is an all-skill level group intended to make golf as accessible as possible for students. Members are encouraged to interact, practice, and play with each other, and benefits include discounts at practice and play areas in the SLO area.
Summary: Provides benefits for members to play golf at discounted rates and have the option to compete in regional tournaments as well as club tournaments.

Name: Cal Poly Hammock Club
Summary: The Hammock Club is a group of individuals who go out and engage with the environment by going on hikes and laying in hammocks.

Name: Cal Poly Industrial Technology Society
Description: Industrial Technology Society has been a club at Cal Poly SLO since 1959. ITS allows students to connect with working professionals within the industry, which is achieved through industry speakers, plant tours, trade shows, open lab hours, and a variety of other professional social events. ITS prepares students by enhancing technical skills, growing their network, and establishing the principles to become the next generation of effective managers and entrepreneurial leaders.
Summary: ITS provides operations focused ITP students with networking opportunities with industry professionals

Name: Cal Poly Investing Club
Description:
Cal Poly Investing was founded to give Cal Poly students of all years and majors a place to learn about and discuss investing of all kinds. We also bring in guest speakers who are successful investors and venture capitalists to educate and indulge our members in their experiences.

Come hang out in our Discord and join in on the discussion! You can find it (and everything else!) within the first link below! (The globe)

We discuss...

 

-stocks

-real estate

-options

-startups

-crypto

-alternative investing

-careers

-and anything else investing!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oKCM2DTyol0
Summary: Cal Poly Investing was founded to give Cal Poly students of all years and majors a place to learn about and discuss investing of all kinds.

Name: Cal Poly Juggling Club
Description:
https://youtu.be/JQ2J7RVUH-8

 

The Cal Poly Juggling Club has been active since 2019. We meet weekly to juggle and practice many forms of juggling including balls, clubs, and rings. Many of us didn't know how to juggle before we joined, so if you're interested in learning, come by and we'll teach you! To see more details, log into Cal Poly Now so the website will show you the 'additional information' tab.
Summary: We meet to learn new tricks and props, practice our old ones, and spread the joy of juggling by teaching others.

Name: Cal Poly League of Legends Club
Description: Provide a campus community for both casual and competitive league of legends players to participate in. Join our Discord server! https://discord.gg/VBSaTxu
Summary: Provide a campus community for both casual and competitive league of legends players to participate in. Join our Discord server! https://discord.gg/VBSaTxu

Name: Cal Poly Magic: The Gathering Club
Description:
We foster a campus community of Magic: The Gathering players.

We host weekly events featuring a wide array of formats.

Join our Discord server to find games or just talk MTG!
Summary:
We foster a campus community of Magic: The Gathering players.

We host weekly events featuring a wide array of formats

Join our Discord server to find games or just talk MTG!

Name: Cal Poly Maritime Golf Club
Summary: Golfers competing at the collegiate golf level while bringing unity through the sport

Name: Cal Poly Men's Beach Volleyball Club
Description:
CP Men's Beach Volleyball is a competitive and social club where our focus is to deliver beach volleyball to our members at the highest level. The club does not operate with the same rigidness as other club sports. With that being said, the thrice weekly practices are an opportunity to play beach volleyball at a high level with the intent of getting better and competing. The hope is for members to attend all practices and tournaments, but there are no penalties for absences. We have designed the club to be laid-back where you want it to be and competitive where it needs to be. 

Tournaments vary along a scale between competitive and fun, such as in-club cash prize tournaments, duels with other schools, or in-club coed quads for the love of the game. Please reach out to any of the officers for information or questions you might have.
Summary: We are a competitive yet social men's beach volleyball club. We have scheduled practices weekly and compete in third party tournaments up and down the coast of California. We compete against club teams from other colleges such as USC, UCLA, etc.

Name: Cal Poly Men's Club Basketball
Description: Cal Poly Club Basketball is an intermediate level of competition between the D1 and intramural leagues. Club Basketball allows its members to continue their passion for the sport by playing against other school's club basketball teams such as UCLA, UCSB, and Stanford. We are in the Pacific - North conference of NCBBA league. We help to develop relationships within the team through activities on and off the court.
Summary: Cal Poly Club Basketball is an intermediate level of competition between the D1 and intramural leagues. This club allows players to continue their love for the game and competitive nature to continue past high school.

Name: Cal Poly Men's Lacrosse CLub
Description: 8x WCLL League Champions. Multiple appearances within the MCLA National Tournament. The Cal Poly Lacrosse team is home to many dedicated, hardworking, and excellent young men. We pride ourselves on fostering a culture of acceptance and competition.
Summary: The Cal Poly Lacrosse Club is a highly competitive, organized, and professional club sport. We compete with teams nationwide in the MCLA as well as locally in the WCLL. We continue to grow in numbers and aim to compete for and win an MCLA championship.

Name: Cal Poly Men's Ultimate Club
Description:
Check Out Our 2025 Highlights!

Slocore practices are Mondays and Thursdays from 7:30pm to 10pm and Saturdays from 9am to 12pm on the lower grass fields. Send us an email with any questions cpslocoreultiumate@gmail.com. Everyone is welcome!
Summary: SLOCORE is the official Men's Ultimate Frisbee team of Cal Poly SLO. Founded in 1978, we represent Cal Poly at Ultimate tournaments across California and beyond!

Name: Cal Poly Men's Water Polo Club
Summary: Men's water polo competes within the Collegiate Water Polo Association against other schools around the nation. If qualified, the team competes in the CWPA national championships at the end of the season.

Name: Cal Poly MERGE Contemporary Dance Club
Description: MERGE Contemporary Dance is a recreational dance club that is centered around building an inclusive community through dance. No audition is required, and all levels are welcome! If you're interested, please follow us on Instagram @calpolymerge or contact cgalassi@calpoly.edu for more information
Summary: Recreational dance club that focuses on contemporary and jazz-based styles.

Name: Cal Poly Moot Court Club
Description: Moot Court enables students to practice public speaking, oral and written debate, and critical thinking skills. Students use Supreme Court case law to support their final arguments to a panel of judges. Members can compete in both written and oral competitions against other schools in scrimmages and national tournaments.
Summary: Gain familiarity with Supreme Court case law and practice public speaking, written debate, and critical thinking skills.

Name: Cal Poly Multiracial Students' Association
Description:
MUSA is dedicated to creating a safe and welcoming space for mixed folx and allies. Our mission is to raise racial awareness, promote a sense of belonging, and foster a strong community. Through open dialogue and shared experiences, we aim to empower the multiracial diaspora and support mixed students as they navigate the complexities of multiracial identity.

Our meetings will include a blend of social events and meaningful conversations. If you're interested in joining, don't hesitate to reach out. We’d love to connect with you!

Linktree | Instagram
Summary: MUSA is a space for mixed-race students and allies to explore identity, share experiences, and connect. Join us for beach trips, craft nights, and real talk. All are welcome, come find your place and your people!

Name: Cal Poly Nursing / PA Club
Description:
The Nursing/PA Club at Cal Poly aims to guide, and support all students who plan to pursue a career in nursing or as a Physician Assistant.
We plan to provide these resources through guest speakers, and volunteer opportunities within the community.
Here are some things we provide to students:
- Volunteer Opportunities

-Guest Speakers
(Nurses and PAs)

-Graduate Schools
to talk about admission requirements

-Previously accepted
Cal Poly students into both programs

-Pre-Health advisors
to talk about all that they offer

We also want to emphasize that members can use this email as a way to ask any sort of questions about classes, professors, tips or tricks about this journey. We will respond the best way possible and redirect you to resources that will be helpful.

Email us at calpolynursing.paclub@gmail.com

Join our GroupMe at: https://groupme.com/join_group/103485794/MlWH0wtS
Summary: Give direction to students aiming for either the Nursing or PA profession. The club networks with admission counselors to familiarize students with each type of program offered. We also provide information with relevant job and volunteer opportunities.

Name: Cal Poly Photography Club
Description:
Cal Poly Photography Club is a casual, low-commitment group that allows students interested in photography of all types to take photos together as well as share their knowledge and love for photography.

All club meetings are optional, there are no membership fees, and no experience required. We welcome anyone who wants to join us, even if you don't have a camera. 

Our meetings are usually off-campus photo shoots with transportation provided at a variety of locations near SLO.

All information about upcoming events are posted on the club Discord server linked below. 

Join the Discord!
Summary: Cal Poly Photography Club is a casual, low-commitment group that allows students interested in photography of all types to take photos together as well as share their knowledge and love for photography.

Name: Cal Poly Pickleball Club
Description:
The Cal Poly Pickleball club will give a space to Cal Poly students to play pickleball at all levels. Beginners can come to learn the game while simultaneously observing our more competitive, veteran players. 

 

Group-Me Link: https://groupme.com/join_group/91732115/AATYUehF
Summary: The Cal Poly Pickleball Club welcomes players of all skill levels. It offers an inclusive environment to improve your court skills and discover a sport you can enjoy for a lifetime!

Name: Cal Poly Pre-Dental Society
Description:
Our purpose as a club is to provide information to educate and prepare students about the field of dentistry and various aspects of the dental profession. Through the club, we make contacts with professionals in the San Luis Obispo County area to create relationships and learn from people who are living our future. We offer resources for many students - whether they want to be a dentist, dental specialist, assistant, dental hygienist, etc. We also work as a support group to help each other get into dental school with as much ease as possible. We hold manual dexterity workshops, visit dental schools, bring in guest dental speakers & admissions representatives, and give basic information on what classes to take and how to prepare for dental school.

The club also provides the opportunity to give back to our nearby communities through dental-related community service. We learn best from our peers who have done the same thing, so sharing our experiences and ideas knocks down all obstacles between us and our future as dentists. Some events we volunteer at include: Give Kids A Smile, CDA Cares, and other local San Luis Obispo community events

Our club was founded in 1999 by a student who is now a practicing dentist in San Luis Obispo County!
Summary: The Cal Poly Pre-Dental Society is a club for students interested in becoming a dentist and looking for a support network for their future dental career.

Name: Cal Poly Private Equity Club
Description: The Cal Poly SLO Private Equity Club is a student-led organization dedicated to cultivating interest and expertise in private equity and related fields. Through educational workshops, industry speaker events, and hands-on investment analysis, the club provides members with the knowledge and tools needed to explore careers in private equity, venture capital, and leveraged finance. Open to students of all majors and experience levels, the club fosters a collaborative environment where members can build financial skills, expand their professional network, and gain a deeper understanding of the private equity landscape.
Summary: Club focused on private equity, offering workshops, guest speakers, and hands-on learning to prepare members for Private Equity, Venture Capital, and finance careers. Open to all majors and experience levels.

Name: Cal Poly Product Management Club
Description: Cal Poly Product Management Club aims to provide a space for students across different disciplines to learn about product management, build a network with like-minded students as well as industry leaders, especially product managers, and participate in engaging workshops and guest speaker sessions to empower our members with the knowledge and skills to succeed in the field. Whether you’re a seasoned student with experience or curious to learn more about the intersection of business, technology, and design, our club welcomes anyone and encourages innovation and creativity.
Summary: Cal Poly PM Club aims to provide a space for students across different disciplines to learn about product management, build a network with peers as well as industry leaders, and immerse themselves at the intersection of business, tech, and design.

Name: Cal Poly Psi Chi Chapter
Description:
Psi Chi is the National Honor Society for psychology students. Psi Chi is a platform for students to form meaningful connections with peers and faculty members, explore career paths, and network within our community and otherwise.

Membership is required to become a board member and to access resources on the Psi Chi website such as research grants. To learn more about becoming a Psi Chi member, click this link: https://psycd.calpoly.edu/undergraduate/psi-chi

All PSY/CD students can attend events, even if you are not a member!

If you have any further questions please email us at psichislo@calpoly.edu or reach out on our Instagram page @cpslopsichi
Summary: Psi Chi is the National Honor Society for psychology students. Psi Chi is a platform for students to form meaningful connections with peers and faculty members, explore career paths, and network within our community and otherwise.

Name: Cal Poly Public Health Club
Description: CPPH Club aims to promote prevention and wellness among our peers and local community by engaging with local community partners to connect members with local public health efforts to gain experience in public health opportunities and advocate for public health policies. The club also provides members with professional development opportunities, career guidance, and graduate school information.
Summary: CPPH Club promotes wellness among our peers and local community, promotes protective health behaviors, connects students with local public health efforts, and shares information on careers and graduate school programs.

Name: Cal Poly Quantitative Finance Club
Description: An organization dedicated to educating students about the field of quantitative finance, including member led presentations, seminars lead by industry professionals, and hands on group projects. We aim to provide a space where members can apply the knowledge they learn through classes in an engaging, highly interdisciplinary environment.
Summary: An organization dedicated to educating students about the field of quantitative finance, including member led presentations, seminars lead by industry professionals, and hands on group projects.

Name: Cal Poly Real Estate Club
Description:
Our mission is to cultivate a network of community, collaboration, development and exploration amongst Cal Poly students who are passionate about the Real Estate Industry.

We are a student run club that meets weekly with industry professionals to help grow student’s networks as well as give them exposure to the various aspects of Real Estate. We also have professional development meetings in which we discuss resumes, LinkedIns, and proper meeting etiquette. We are constantly informing students of internships and even take field trips to visit Real Estate firms in San Fransisco and Los Angeles.
Summary: Club exposes students at Cal Poly to the many different facets of within the Real Estate industry.

Name: Cal Poly Red Cross Club
Description:
The Cal Poly Red Cross Club strives to extend the humanitarian efforts of the American Red Cross to the Cal Poly and San Luis Obispo communities. Our volunteer opportunities and blood drives allow students to give back to the community, while training and certifications help prepare members for emergency situations. Through our additional focus on the functions of a nonprofit, we plan to enrich leadership and networking opportunities for all members. We strive to provide members with a comprehensive emergency education in order to make our campus community safer.

We host quarterly events such as blood drives, donations, and volunteering so that students can get involved with Red Cross. In order to be a member of the club, students will need to join through CP Now and sign up as an official Red Cross volunteer through Volunteer Connections.
Summary: The Cal Poly Red Cross Club strives to extend the humanitarian efforts of the American Red Cross to the Cal Poly and SLO communities. Our certification classes, blood drives, and visits from healthcare professionals promote a safer and healthier campus.

Name: Cal Poly Roller Hockey Club
Description: https://youtu.be/wD8VQscxoNk
Summary: The Roller Hockey Club is made up of multiple competitive teams that compete in the WCRHL. The club offers participation to players of all skill levels. Come join and try out for our inline hockey team.

Name: Cal Poly Rotaract Club
Description: We are a community and international service-oriented club dedicated to finding impactful projects that utilize the knowledge of all majors. We partner with organizations that need our help. We have multiple committees, such as an engineering design team, that develop solutions to these community and organizational problems. We also have an Interact Committee that works with local high schools and middle schools, giving speeches and demonstrations about Rotaract members' majors to help inspire the next generation of college students. We provide outlets for vauble connections and for memebrs to work on their own committees and projects to futher their own career, as well as enhance the quality of life of club partners.
Summary: Rotaract clubs bring together people ages 18-30 to exchange ideas with leaders in the community, develop leadership and professional skills, and have fun through service.

Name: Cal Poly Roundnet Club
Description: We are the HUB for Spikeball ( the sport of Roundnet ) at Cal Poly SLO! Our goal is to have every person that comes out to club meetings learn and love the game this club is promoting! Follow us for more information on instagram @calpolyspike.
Summary: We are the HUB for Spikeball ( the sport of Roundnet ) at Cal Poly SLO! Our goal is to have every person that comes out to club meetings learn and love the game this club is promoting! Follow us for more information on instagram @calpolyspike.

Name: Cal Poly Rowing Club
Summary: Cal Poly Rowing aims to provide Mustangs of all experience levels the opportunity to discover or continue participation in the sport of rowing. CPR members can expect to row in boats ranging from singles to eights in pursuit of competitive excellence.

Name: Cal Poly Rugby Club
Description:
Cal Poly Rugby is the official club rugby team of Cal Poly, San Luis Obispo. Cal Poly Rugby features three grade men's teams and a women's team. The men's team competes at the USA Rugby D1A level and the women's team competes at the USA Rugby D2 level. It is an inclusive program catering to all talent and experience levels. 

 

Follow us on Instagram for updates!

Men's Team: calpolyrugby

Women's Team: calpolywrugby

 

To learn more about the team, practices, and the sport itself, feel free to contact one of our recruitment officers:

Men's Team: Sam Weston - (916) 693-8681

Women's Team: Mia Nelson - mnelso69@calpoly.edu & Kiri Vogelsang - kvogelsa@calpoly.edu

 

Men's Rugby

Women's Rugby

Sign Up Form

More Club Info
Summary: Club Sports Team

Name: Cal Poly Sailing Team
Description:
https://youtu.be/CIU_hEw0s_0

Follow us on instagram @Calpolysailing
Summary: The Cal Poly Sailing Team is a competitive Club Sport team at Cal Poly. The team competes in regattas sanctioned by the Inter-Collegiate Sailing Association of North America.

Name: Cal Poly Salsa Club
Description: The Cal Poly Salsa Club (CPSalsa) is a student-driven social and dance club focused on spreading the joy of salsa, bachata, and other forms of Afro-Latin social dancing to San Luis Obispo and the rest of the Central Coast. Our goal is to provide high-quality dance lessons, social dancing events, and other social activities to people of all backgrounds and ages while striving to maintain an environment that is safe, inclusive, and welcoming. No experience or partner is required to become a member or participate! Follow our social media and join our mailing list for weekly updates on all of our events!
Summary: Since 2000, the Cal Poly Salsa Club (CPSalsa) has been dedicated to promoting salsa, bachata, and other forms of Afro-Latin social dancing to San Luis Obispo and the rest of the Central Coast. Learn to dance with us, no partner or experience necessary!

Name: Cal Poly Scholars
Description:
Sign in to view Scholar events!

 

The Cal Poly Scholars program seeks to support and retain high-achieving students from California schools, who come from low-income backgrounds, by providing financial, academic, and community resources. 

 

As a university-wide program, the Cal Poly Scholars program brings together a network of services, including the Office of Financial Aid & Scholarships, Mustang Success Center, all six academic colleges, Career Services, University Housing, Student Academic Services, and other campus collaborators. 

 

Currently, Scholars span across all six academic colleges at Cal Poly and are actively pursuing degrees from 50+ majors.  

 

Main Office

  • Building 15, second floor
  • Monday - Friday: 8 a.m. - 5 p.m. (excluding University Holidays)
  • Study space and more!

Building 15 

  • Monday - Thursday: 8 a.m. - 8 p.m. (excluding University Holidays)
  • Friday: 8 a.m. - 5 p.m. (excluding University Holidays)
  • Printing, snacks, study space, and more!

Platforms     

  • Website: scholars.calpoly.edu
  • Instagram: calpolyscholars
  • Canvas: canvas.calpoly.edu/courses/107872
  • LinkedIn: Cal Poly Scholars
Summary: The Cal Poly Scholars program seeks to support and retain high-achieving students from California schools, who come from low-income backgrounds, by providing financial, academic, and community resources.

Name: Cal Poly Security Education Club
Description:
We host two meetings each week. In our general meetings (Tuesdays 6-7pm), we bring in a speaker to talk about a cybersecurity-related topic. In the past, these talks have covered recently discovered vulnerabilities, the cybersecurity implications of a specific technology, and advice on starting a cybersecurity career. In our CTF meetings (Saturdays 1-3pm), we participate in CTFs (hacking competitions), host workshops on how to approach different CTF challenge categories, and do fun special events (wardriving, hardware challenges, etc.).

No prior experience in cybersecurity is required to come to meetings.
Summary: We are a group of security-oriented individuals who aim to teach and develop our security expertise through weekly talks, hands-on activities and competitions, and interdisciplinary research. Open to all majors!

Name: Cal Poly SLOverwatch Club
Description: SLOverwatch is a club connected to the overall Esports community on campus. We are a welcoming environment for both casual and competitive players of Blizzard Entertainment's video game Overwatch 2. While we are mainly a community group to make friends and socialize, we also offer opportunities to play competitively at a collegiate level.
Summary: SLOverwatch is a club connected to the overall Esports community on campus. We are a welcoming environment for both casual and competitive players of the video game Overwatch 2. Our primary purpose is to provide fun events and to make friends!

Name: Cal Poly Sociology Club
Summary: The organization will provide sociology students with support within their major, connections with the department and local organizations, and help students find their niche within the sociological field.

Name: Cal Poly Solano Women's Rugby Club
Summary: To create and foster a fun and competitive atmosphere where students are allowed to play rugby.

Name: Cal Poly Squash Club
Description:
Cal Poly Squash Club is dedicated to building a strong, inclusive community for students who are passionate about squash or curious to learn the sport. Whether you're a complete beginner walking onto the court for the first time or an experienced player, our club offers a space to develop your skills, stay active, and connect with others who share an interest in this fast-paced and strategic game.

We host weekly meetings that include friendly matches, mini-tournaments, and instructional clinics led by both experienced members and our club advisor, who has over 35 years of squash experience and currently competes in the Squash Masters League. These sessions focus on everything from game rules and proper technique to court etiquette, injury prevention, and match strategies. We also hold conditioning workouts to help members improve their endurance, coordination, and squash-specific movement. In addition to weekly practices, we bring in guest coaches, competitive players, and local squash professionals to lead advanced training sessions, offer insights, and share their experiences in the sport. We also plan to host tournaments that invite teams and players from other universities, giving our members opportunities to compete at a higher level and engage with the broader squash community.
Summary: Cal Poly Squash Club welcomes all skill levels to learn, play, and compete in squash. We host practices, clinics, and matches, with guidance from experienced players and our advisor. Join us to improve, stay active, and build a squash community on campus

Name: Cal Poly Student Chapter of the Association for Women in Mathematics
Description: Association for Women in Mathematics (AWM) is a social and academic club. All majors and genders are welcome to join; the only thing required is a passion for math! AWM is the Cal Poly chapter of a national organization that works to encourage women to study and have active careers in math, and promotes equal opportunity for women in math. Club activities include volunteering opportunities, social events, guest lectures, and enjoying free pizza at every meeting! Meetings take place every two weeks. To contact AWM, find us on Instagram at @awmcalpolyslo or email womeninmath@calpoly.edu.
Summary: A society that aims to support women and minorities in mathematics and to influence the culture of mathematics as a whole.

Name: Cal Poly Student Veterans and Dependents Club
Description: A club for military connected students that builds community and provides resources.
Summary: A club for military connected students that builds community and provides resources.

Name: Cal Poly Surfrider Foundation
Description:
At Surfrider, we do a variety of different events and collaborations with other clubs and organizations on campus and in the community. Some of our most popular events include beach cleanups, our annual Make Waves Film Festival, house shows, up-cycling/artivism projects, educational workshops, and many outdoor activities to build a strong and active community. We hope you will join us in our efforts to protect our oceans, beaches, and coastlines. 

Check out our club video to learn more about what Surfrider is all about!
Summary: We are a student chapter of Surfrider Foundation, a national non-profit organization dedicated to the protection and enjoyment of the world's oceans, beaches, and waves for all. We have many programs that focus on education and advocacy for our coastline

Name: Cal Poly Survivor Club
Description: Our club creates an opportunity for Cal Poly students to meet new people while competing in an exciting strategic game based on the show Survivor. If you don't want to play, you can also join a welcoming community of all reality TV lovers. Executive positions will also enable members to enhance their skills in the areas of filming, editing, development, and social media marketing. We not only recreate the hit TV show Survivor but also film and produce the entire TV show uploading to YouTube, giving students a unique opportunity to allow parents, family, and friends to watch their loved one in a reality TV show all hosted on Cal Poly campus. The club also holds fun events, and watch parties of our favorite reality TV shows.
Summary: Our club creates an opportunity for Cal Poly students to meet new people while competing in an exciting strategic game based on the hit CBS TV show Survivor. If you don't want to play, you can also join a welcoming community of all reality TV lovers!

Name: Cal Poly Sustainable Fashion Club
Description:
Sustainable Fashion Club (SFC) upholds the spirit on which it was founded in 2020: Education, Artistry, and Community. The purpose of the club is to educate the student body on topics such as fast fashion, consumer awareness, and sustainable fashion practices. SFC creates space for students from a variety of intersecting identities to celebrate artistry, support individual style, and foster a community with special mind to conscious consumerism. Through educating our community, we advocate for ecological integrity and social justice through fashion.

Our goals:

  • Education: To inform its members and the greater community of San Luis Obispo of the benefits of sustainable fashion practices. Including shopping second-hand, supporting sustainable brands and local businesses, and recycling/repurposing clothing. We seek to bring awareness to members of the inextricable link between environmental racism and fashion within justice, equity, diversity, and inclusion (JEDI) efforts. 
  • Artistry: One's choice of clothing is a form of personal expression and creativity. We believe fashion and artistry go hand in hand. SFC seeks to celebrate and elevate all styles and art forms.
  • Community: The club makes space for students to maintain a welcoming, representative community for students interested in sustainable fashion and environmental justice. Sustainable Fashion Club is a place where those passionate about ecological integrity, social justice, and fashion can come together, network, educate, be heard, and support one another’s artistry. We welcome all identities.
Summary: This club will be used to inform students of the benefits of sustainable fashion practices, celebrate creativity, and create space for students of all intersecting identities. Our three main goals are education, artistry, and community.

Name: Cal Poly Swim Club
Description:
Swim Club is a competitive, fun club with over 100 current members! We host many practices every week, attend meets across the state, and engage in a lot of social events. Swimmers of all levels are welcome to come see what we're about!

 

Check out our website for information on how to register, the schedule, and other FAQs: https://calpolyswimclub.com/ 

 

If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to our club president Tyler Innes by email: tinnes@calpoly.edu
Summary: From beginners to former NCAA Division I swimmers, Swim Club is a fun and competitive club that offers training for swimmers of all abilities. We are a part of CISCA and CCS.

Name: Cal Poly Swing Club
Description: https://youtu.be/tZ2WPEMB5PU
Summary: We are a group of dancers who love Lindy Hop, Charleston, Collegiate Shag, Balboa, and various other varieties of swing. All levels welcome! We have free lessons on Sundays from 1-3pm, dance at Madonna Inn every Monday from 8-10pm, and dance around SLO!

Name: Cal Poly Table Tennis Club
Summary: Cal Poly Table Tennis is a group of students interested in developing their skills in table tennis in an encouraging, supportive environment. We welcome all ability levels and also offer the opportunity for competitive and recreational play.

Name: Cal Poly Taekwondo Club
Summary: Cal Poly Taekwondo Club is staffed with experienced Taekwondo athletes who are passionate about creating community through Taekwondo, the unique and history-rich martial art.

Name: Cal Poly TAGA Club
Summary: Cal Poly TAGA, or Technical Association of the Graphic Arts, is a hands-on, competitive Graphic Communication club that focuses on designing and producing a technical research journal and introducing students to the graphics for printing industry.

Name: Cal Poly Tech Sales Club
Description: Our organization is to promote business opportunities within the field of tech and would like to specifically help connect Cal Poly account executives, business development representatives, and sales development representatives to students at Cal Poly so they can learn more about the field. We provide networking opportunities to students and we host fun socials.
Summary: We are Cal Poly's new B2B software sales club, (tech sales). We want to give students, specifically any students the opportunity to learn more and get involved in SAAS sales. Our focus is to help students become BDRs, SDRs, and Account Executives.

Name: Cal Poly Technical and Professional Communication Club
Description: The TPC club is focused on building a community and giving real-world experiences alongside the technical and professional communication program at Cal Poly. We aim to teach members how they can apply their skills in professional communication and technical writing to all careers and paths and help build their skillset and portfolios through hands-on collaborations and projects in TPC. Our goal is to create a space in which students can grow their skills and learn in a judgment-free environment, and find friendship and familiarity in their fellow students, meeting people from all different backgrounds and majors.
Summary: A club focused on community building and giving real-world, hands-on experiences to members of the Technical and Professional Communication program at Cal Poly.

Name: Cal Poly Textile Engineering Club
Description: The goal of Cal Poly's Textile Engineering club is to represent synthetic materials in engineering and provide opportunities to develop our own textiles. Students aim to establish connections with industries that work with polymers and fibers.
Summary: The goal of Cal Poly's Textile Engineering club is to represent synthetic materials in engineering and provide opportunities to develop our own textiles. Students aim to establish connections with industries that work with polymers, fibers, and plastics.
CategoryNames: College of Agriculture, Food & Environmental Science

Name: Cal Poly Theisms Club
Description:
A Religious Studies Club aims to promote open-minded and thoughtful reflection upon issues important to Religious Studies with activities, speakers, and other programs. Cal Poly Theisms was first formed in the fall of 2006 as an opportunity for Religious Studies minors and other interested students to gather and to engage important Religious Studies issues.

It has the following specific goals:

  • To act as a unifying body for Religious Studies minors.
  • To promote the responsible, rigorous, and respectful discussion of religious issues on campus.
  • To bring to campus interesting speakers and presenters on religious issues.
  • To organize activities connected to important topics in the field of Religious Studies.
  • To serve as a hub for dialogue between different religiously-affiliated groups on campus.

Check out our Instagram here! https://www.instagram.com/calpoly.theisms/

Here's a link to our Group Me, which is our main method of communication as well!

https://groupme.com/join_group/97527954/a8W5ktVz

 

Tags: Religion, Spirituality, Spiritual
Summary: We promote open-minded and thoughtful reflection upon issues important to Religious Studies with activities, speakers, and other programs.

Name: Cal Poly Triathlon Team
Description:
https://youtu.be/o3HUvZu5KuI

 

The Cal Poly Triathlon Team is one of the largest club sports on campus, appealing to any level of athlete. Whether you consider yourself a veteran swim-bike-runner, or are just joining to complete your first triathlon, we welcome you to our family with open arms, bikes, and shoes!

 

Our team mission is: ​to make the sport of triathlon accessible and affordable for all collegiate athletes, while promoting a competitive and fun atmosphere to help members achieve their athletic goals.

 

The San Luis Obispo community is well suited for all types of triathletes. With the help of some amazing sponsorships and coaches, we are one of the biggest and best teams in the nation. We compete with elite schools in the West Coast Collegiate Triathlon Conference, and proudly uphold our tradition of being a hard team to beat.

 

While none of our practices are mandatory, they are all strongly encouraged. Attending workouts is not only a great way to become acquainted with all of the student coaches and hone your skills but also a great way to meet other triathletes on the team!

 

Add us on Instagram! @cptri

 

Check out the practice schedule on our website! http://www.calpolytriathlon.com/

 

West Coast Collegiate Triathlon Conference race schedule: https://www.wcctc.com/race-calendar-2/
Summary: The Cal Poly Triathlon Team is one of the largest club sports on campus, appealing to any level of athlete. Whether you consider yourself a veteran swim-bike-runner or are just joining to complete your first triathlon, we welcome you to our family!

Name: Cal Poly Unicycle Club
Description:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4X7tT1ndtR0

 

The Cal Poly Unicycle Club brings together unicyclists in a safe environment to teach anyone how to ride a unicycle, regardless of skill level. Meetings are Tue/Fri 6-8pm at the Sierra Madre Basketball Courts. We welcome new members year-round! To see more details, log into Cal Poly Now so the website will show you the 'additional information' tab.
Summary: The Cal Poly Unicycle Club exists to teach anyone interested how to ride a unicycle for the first time, and also level up skills of existing riders. We hope to promote the sport of unicycling within our campus community in a safe and fun environment.

Name: Cal Poly Urbanists Club
Description: People-powered planning powered by student activism. We focus on enhancing bike and pedestrian safety and accessibility on campus and in San Luis Obispo.
Summary: We are looking to promote the real world application of planning principles in order to empower Cal Poly students to enact the change they wish to seek on campus and in SLO through activism and community engagement.

Name: Cal Poly Valorant Club
Description:
https://discord.gg/C8M6ePETxJ

Join our discord to meet other members from our club!

We host many different events throughout the year for both casual and competitive players!
We also have our competitive teams who compete against other schools in the CVAL tournaments and more!
Summary: The one-stop for Valorant on campus. We welcome Casual and Competitive Valorant players!

Name: Cal Poly Van Life Club
Description:
Whether you've hand-built a camper van to travel the country or just now heard of the tiny-living movement, the Cal Poly Van Life Club welcomes you! No vans or vehicles are required to be apart of our club! All are welcome to adventure with us!

 

What exactly is Van Life? 

Van Life in its simplest form encompasses the conversion of a vehicle into a living-space on wheels.

  

Van Life can also mean travel, recreation, and accessibility to the outdoors. It can mean design, innovation, and DIY craftsmanship. A means of living for some and a community for all. Even a rapidly growing industry. 

 

Van Life, as we see it, isn’t exclusive to a traditional “van” either: 

We recognize this same movement no matter the form! Truck campers, trailer-based tiny homes, whatever it may be - we welcome it!    

 

What does the Van Life Club do? 

At our core we seek to host a community of individuals with interest, to any degree, in Van Life as a lifestyle or just a vibe.

  

The scope of the club often includes community meetups, local caravan & camping trips, discussion around interior & accessory design, and networking with established brand & organizations. We also support the outreach of emergency housing resources provided by the campus Basic Needs team.  

--- 

Involved, interested, or intrigued by Van Life? Attend one of our meetings or contact us directly below to learn more!
Summary: A Van Life/ Tiny-House based club with a focus on travel, recreation & alternative living. Members also discuss DIY camper conversions. Ownership of a vehicle is not required to participate and all are welcome!

Name: Cal Poly Water Ski Team
Description:
As a team, we compete against other colleges from all over the West Coast, taking part in slalom, trick, and jump events as a member team of the NCWSA. The Water Ski team is open to skiers of all levels, from people who may have never gotten up on a slalom ski before to seasoned tournament participants. Practice is held at nearby Lake Nacimiento throughout the school year, and tournaments are conducted all over California. The team is competitive at both regionals and nationals, while also being very welcoming to new skiers. 

Interested in the team? Check out our instagram @cpwaterski
Summary: The Cal Poly Water Ski team promotes the sport of competitive Water Skiing up and down the West Coast and on National levels. We provide students of all skill levels with access to practice and coaching in slalom, trick, and jump events.

Name: Cal Poly Wilderness Medicine Society
Description:
The Wilderness Medicine Society at Cal Poly is where medicine meets the edge of the map. Founded to bridge the worlds of healthcare, science, and exploration, we prepare students to think and act like clinicians in the most challenging environments on Earth: from alpine rescues to disaster zones to remote field stations.

Our mission is to expose students to the field of wilderness and austere medicine: a discipline that tests creativity, adaptability, and leadership under pressure. Through guest speakers, Wilderness First Aid trainings, hikes, and other outdoor experiences, we explore how medical care operates beyond the walls of hospitals and clinics: at altitude, at sea, in isolation, and in resource-limited conditions.
Summary: Explore where medicine meets the outdoors. The Wilderness Medicine Society connects students passionate about healthcare, adventure, and exploration through speakers, workshops, and field-inspired learning experiences.

Name: Cal Poly Women in Business Association
Description: WIB acts as a resource for young women that mobilizes and empowers them to thrive academically, socially and professionally in order to achieve long-term success. We support women in gaining the skills and training they need to successfully position themselves in a highly competitive workplace via relevant programming and proactive advocacy. We strive to empower students through connection to, and mentorship from, alumni and prominent female leaders within the community.
Summary: Founded in Spring 2015, the Cal Poly Women in Business Association was created to act as a resource and community for young women, working to provide students with the skills and network needed to succeed in college and life.

Name: Cal Poly Women in Electrical Engineering Club
Description:
Cal Poly IEEE Women in Electrical Engineering Club is a support group for female Electrical
Engineering majors at the California Polytechnic State University.
Summary: Cal Poly IEEE Women in Electrical Engineering Club is a support group for female Electrical Engineering majors at the California Polytechnic State University.

Name: Cal Poly Women in Politics Club
Description: The Women in Politics Club provides all Cal Poly students with the opportunity to learn from women in political careers and/or with political experience. This club showcases a diverse selection of future careers for students to prepare for. The club also provides students with practical resources to learn substantive skills for their future workplace.By connecting students with experts and helping them refine critical skills, the club prepares members for a successful future in politics and related fields.
Summary: The Women in Politics Club provides all students with the opportunity to learn from women in political careers/with political experience. We will showcase a diverse selection of future careers to students, focusing outside of stereotypical career paths.

Name: Cal Poly Women's Club Baseball
Description: We are a women's club baseball team that gives women of all skill levels a chance to learn and play baseball. We will compete in games and tournaments against other women's college club baseball teams. We want to grow the community of women in baseball and help each member grow as a person and teammate.
Summary: We are a club baseball team that gives women an opportunity to play and learn baseball and compete in games and tournaments against women's club teams at other colleges. We want to grow the community of women in this sport and build a community.

Name: Cal Poly Women's Club Volleyball
Description:
Cal Poly Women's Club Volleyball offers intercollegiate competition at the club volleyball level. The club was founded so that Cal Poly female athletes who love volleyball can compete at a club level while still achieving academic success as full time students.

The club's two teams compete in the Northern California Collegiate Volleyball League (NCCVL) during the months of January, February, and March, and in the National Collegiate Volleyball Federation (NCVF) at Nationals in April. Tryouts, practices, and tournaments begin early Fall and the season ends in the beginning of Spring quarter.
Summary: Cal Poly Women's Club Volleyball offers intercollegiate competition at the club volleyball level.

Name: Cal Poly Women's Club Water Polo
Description:
Check out our website for up-to-date team information!  Team Website

https://youtu.be/wXd3fzWZ4Hg
Summary: The Cal Poly Club Women's Water polo team is a group of athletes that compete at tournaments in the Pacific Coast Division of the Collegiate Water Polo Association. We are an inclusive team that collectively shares the love for the game.

Name: Cal Poly Women's Lacrosse Team
Description:
Cal Poly Women's Lacrosse was established in 1991 and competes regionally in Division I and Division II of the Western Women's Lacrosse League (WWLL) and nationally in the Women's Collegiate Lacrosse Association (WCLA).

We have Fall Ball fall quarter where players of all skill levels are welcome to come and play. Fall Ball is an informal time for players to get to know each other and connect with alumni. We learn plays and defense sets so players become familiar with them going into the season.

​Tryouts are November 13th through the 16th. The season typically goes from January to mid-May.

We have two teams here at Cal Poly.

​Our A Team is in Division I and can travel to playoffs and nationals at the end of the season. A Team practices 5 times a week for 2 hours and 1-2 games on the weekend. A team has cuts and is more competitive. 

​B Team is in Division 2 and also can travel to playoffs and nationals. B Team practices 4 times a week for 2 hours and has games on the weekend. B team is non-cut and welcomes players of all skill levels.
Summary: Home of the 7-time National Champions, Cal Poly Women's Lacrosse competes in Division I & Division II of the Western Women's Lacrosse League as we play various teams throughout California.

Name: Cal Poly Yu-Gi-Oh! Club
Description:
Cal Poly Yu-Gi-Oh! Club strives to create a friendly atmosphere for those interested in learning or playing the game Yu-Gi-Oh!

https://discord.gg/SQBPqvMh
Summary:
Cal Poly Yu-Gi-Oh! Club strives to create a friendly atmosphere for those interested in learning or playing the game Yu-Gi-Oh!
https://discord.gg/SQBPqvMh

Name: California Polytechnic State University, San Luis Obispo Panhellenic Association
Description:
The Panhellenic Association (PHA) at Cal Poly San Luis Obispo is composed of nine member sororities: Alpha Chi Omega, Alpha Omicron Pi, Alpha Phi, Chi Omega, Delta Gamma, Gamma Phi Beta, Kappa Alpha Theta, Kappa Kappa Gamma, and Sigma Kappa. We strive to Leave A Legacy by helping women develop academically, socially, and morally. 

We, the undergraduate members of women’s fraternities, stand for good scholarship, for guarding of good health, for maintenance of fine standards, and for serving, to the best of our ability, our college community. Cooperation for furthering fraternity life, in harmony with its best possibilities, is the ideal that shall guide our fraternity activities.

We, the fraternity women, stand for service through the development of character inspired by close contact and deep friendship of individual fraternity and Panhellenic life. The opportunity for wide and wise human service, through mutual respect and helpfulness, is the tenet by which we strive to live
Summary: This organization falls under the NPC and oversees the affiliated sororities on Cal Poly's Campus.

Name: California Polytechnic State University, San Luis Obispo Student Chapter of The Wildlife Society
Description: Cal Poly Wildlife Club is a student chapter of The Wildlife Society and provides students interested in a career in wildlife with professional development, field skill workshops, outdoor excursions, and more! We meet every Thursday at 11am in Fisher Science 287. Check our link tree to follow us on Instagram @calpolywildlifeclub, join our GroupMe, or sign up for our email list for up-to-date info on club matters and meetings.
Summary: Wildlife Club is a student chapter of The Wildlife Society and provides students interested in a career in wildlife with networking opportunities and workshops. We meet every Thursday at 11am.
CategoryNames: College of Agriculture, Food & Environmental Science

Name: Campus Health & Wellbeing
Description: Campus Health & Wellbeing has its goal to provide appropriate care in a timely manner to maximize student success at Cal Poly by minimizing the effects of suboptimal health, including preventable and resolvable mental and physical impediments to learning and performance. Our objectives include preventing physical and emotional problems, and if they occur, designing interventions that will rapidly allow the student to return to and succeed in the learning environment. We also strive to minimize the impact of students’ emotional and physical problems on others, through education about preventing the spread of illness and working with campus resources to provide appropriate living arrangements for those with special needs.
Summary: Campus Health  Wellbeing

Name: Can of Worms Comedy Club
Description:
Enjoy watching stand-up comedy?
Ever want to give it a shot?
You're in the right place!

Can of Worms is the established production organization for stand-up comedy at Cal Poly.
Our club has produced shows with dozens of professional stand-up comedians from the Bay Area down to Los Angeles and everywhere in between. Come join us! We need all types of people to help produce these shows from technicians to logistics masterminds to funny people in order to make it happen!
Summary: Can of Worms Comedy Club is the club for you if you want to venture out into the dazzling world of stand-up comedy! Whether you like to watch or perform stand-up comedy Can of Worms has open mics, themed nights, workshops, and showcases all year round!

Name: Career Services
Description:
Services include:

Career Counseling Appointments

Drop-In Career Advising Hours

MustangJobs

Workshops

Career Fairs

Student Resource Toolkit

Career Connections (alumni/student networking platform)
Summary: Career Services empowers students to achieve a lifetime of meaningful career success by engaging with Cal Poly's vibrant network. We'll help you explore career possibilities, and provide guidance and resources to jump-start your career planning!

Name: Center for Leadership
Description:
For a decade, the Center for Leadership’s Mission has been to help every student discover and develop their personal styles of leadership. We incorporate the most up-to-date leadership models, professional feedback, and student input into our professional certificate courses, available to all students at no extra cost. Outside of our certificate series, we are committed to advancing the leadership skills of the entire campus community–in clubs, classrooms, and peer-to-peer mentoring. Not every leader is a Mustang, but every Mustang is a leader.

 

 

We offer the following Leadership Certificates each quarter:

 

Emerging Leadership Series:

Build leadership skills, practice teamwork and communication skills, and connect with other student leaders through an inclusive lens. The Emerging Leaders Series is open to all students (no experience required), and provides an engaging way for students to expand their perspective on leadership.

 

Global Leadership Series:

Engage in your leadership journey that is specifically gauged towards applying your leadership skills across cultures and contexts. You will explore personal, local, national, and global issues within leadership and identify the knowledge, skills, and awareness necessary to navigate these different contexts.

 

Peer Leadership Series:

Increase your leadership competency related to positional leadership roles you hold or aspire to hold (on or off campus). This certificate will increase students’ confidence, self-efficacy, and toolkit in order to start or continue being an impactful positional leader. We believe that equity and social justice are inherent parts of leadership and thus have incorporated these topics into all four weeks of the series.

 

Social Change Leadership Series:

SCL uses the Social Change Model of Leadership Development (the most widely-utilized model of leadership development on college campuses) as a framework for understanding leadership. Additionally, students who complete SCL will participate in two hours of service learning.
Summary: The Center for Leadership fosters socially responsible leadership development through high impact practices, programs, and events. The center fosters personal growth, determination and self-awareness while providing guidance and inspiration.
